TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit CharacterMetrics extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents the metrics used to lay out a character in a device font.
Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics> object is constructed using the default metric values.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string metrics) cil managed

Docs.param: A comma-delimited value that represents the metrics for the character.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class by specifying the metrics as a string.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `metrics` parameter is a comma-delimited string that specifies the <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics> properties in the following order:
- <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.BlackBoxWidth%2A>
- <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.BlackBoxHeight%2A>
- <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.Baseline%2A>
- <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.LeftSideBearing%2A>
- <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.RightSideBearing%2A>
- <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.TopSideBearing%2A>
- <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.BottomSideBearing%2A>
The first two properties, <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.BlackBoxWidth%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.BlackBoxHeight%2A>, are required. However, the other five properties are optional, and will default to zero if not specified. For example, if you specify the string value of "0.75,0.75,,0.1" for the `metrics` parameter, the <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.BlackBoxWidth%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.BlackBoxHeight%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.LeftSideBearing%2A> properties are set - the unspecified properties are set to zero.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Baseline As Double
public: property double Baseline { double get(); };

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets the baseline value for the character.
Docs.value: A value of type representing the baseline.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The return value represents the vertical offset from the bottom of the black box to the baseline. A positive value indicates the baseline is above the bottom of the black box, while a negative value indicates the baseline is below the bottom of the black box.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property BlackBoxHeight As Double
public: property double BlackBoxHeight { double get(); };

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets the height of the black box for the character.
Docs.value: A value of type representing the black box height.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property BlackBoxWidth As Double
public: property double BlackBoxWidth { double get(); };

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets the width of the black box for the character.
Docs.value: A value of type representing the black box width.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property BottomSideBearing As Double
public: property double BottomSideBearing { double get(); };

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets the recommended white space below the black box.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A negative value indicates an overhang. The vertical advance for the character is the sum of the property values <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.TopSideBearing%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.BlackBoxHeight%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.BottomSideBearing%2A>. The vertical advance cannot be less than zero.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance bool Equals(object obj) cil managed
Public Overrides Function Equals (obj As Object) As Boolean

Docs.param: The object to compare to the current object.
Docs.summary: Determines whether the specified object is equal to the current object.
Docs.returns: if the objects are equal; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Two <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics> objects are equal if the following properties are equal:
<xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.BlackBoxHeight%2A>
<xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.BlackBoxWidth%2A>
<xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.BottomSideBearing%2A>
<xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.LeftSideBearing%2A>
<xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.RightSideBearing%2A>
<xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.TopSideBearing%2A>

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance int32 GetHashCode() cil managed
Public Overrides Function GetHashCode () As Integer

Docs.summary: Creates a hash code from the metric values of the object.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property LeftSideBearing As Double
public: property double LeftSideBearing { double get(); };

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets the recommended white space to the left of the black box.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A negative value indicates an overhang. The horizontal advance for the character is
the sum of the property values <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.LeftSideBearing%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.BlackBoxWidth%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.RightSideBearing%2A>. The horizontal advance cannot be less than zero.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ Metrics { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.Metrics : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a comma-delimited string representing metric values.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.String> value is a comma-delimited string that specifies the <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics> properties in the following order:
- <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.BlackBoxWidth%2A>
- <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.BlackBoxHeight%2A>
- <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.Baseline%2A>
- <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.LeftSideBearing%2A>
- <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.RightSideBearing%2A>
- <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.TopSideBearing%2A>
- <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.BottomSideBearing%2A>
The first two properties, <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.BlackBoxWidth%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.BlackBoxHeight%2A>, are required. However, the other five properties are optional, and will default to zero if not specified. For example, if you specify the string value of "`0.75,0.75,,0.1`" for the `metrics` parameter, the <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.BlackBoxWidth%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.BlackBoxHeight%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.LeftSideBearing%2A> properties are set - the unspecified properties are set to zero.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property RightSideBearing As Double
public: property double RightSideBearing { double get(); };

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets the recommended white space to the right of the black box.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A negative value indicates an overhang. The horizontal advance for the character is
the sum of the property values <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.LeftSideBearing%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.BlackBoxWidth%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.RightSideBearing%2A>. The horizontal advance cannot be less than zero.

public: property double TopSideBearing { double get(); };

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets the recommended white space above the black box.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Recommended white space above the black box. The vertical advance for the character is the sum of the property values <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.TopSideBearing%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.BlackBoxHeight%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.BottomSideBearing%2A>. The vertical advance cannot be less than zero.
